intro: Senecio forbesii, commonly known as Forbes' groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, with a woolly texture that helps retain moisture. Senecio forbesii produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
